title: RN Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: I saw another review that said their interview went as if the manager was intentionally trying to find deficiencies, and that is also how mine went. Felt like I was taking the NCLEX again instead of being asked how I am as an employee. This would have been a new position for me, so I didn't have all the exact answers. Maybe they were looking for someone very experienced, but the job description did not indicate that(asked for one year of experience in an ICU setting, which I have). I've never really had an interview like that, so it was a bit difficult.Also, it took almost a month to get a response back from the recruiter after the interview.
Interview Questions:
Lab interpretations, many specific clinical scenario questions, how to set up specific equipment(even though my resume and myself  stated that I have not yet worked in this area)
Why do you want to work for scripps
What are you learning right now, personally or professionally
Tell me about a time you had conflict
Tell me about a time you went above and beyond

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: There is a standard /Stock list of questions that are outdated, and potentially don't identify the candidate well. "What makes a good day for you?" the answer they want is BUSY because that's typical for a nurse, working super hard all day,. "how would your previous manager describe you?" Maybe just ask for a previous evaluation. "Do you like to treat others like you like to be treated?" The "answer" is "no I treat others how they want to be treated". I guess it is all to standardize the process with dumb questions. I've sat in on interviews and most of these questions throw the candidate off and make they feel nervous and I just feel SOOO bad for the candidate! It's embarrassing. But interviews typically cause some nervousness anyway,.
Interview Questions: See above questions. They have a list of standard questions for nursing. "What makes a good day for you?" "How do you feel about unfinished work?" Obviously, one would say "I hate unfinished work"! whether or not you do or don't. Right?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: part one is a round of video submissions about how you would fit into the role. very easy set up. easier than coming up with a 30 word minimum for this section of the questions.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Encinitas, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled a virtual interview with Scripps Health at the Encinitas location, three days after I applied. On the day of the interview, the hiring supervisor was completely absent. I had to email Scripps myself, and I received a response two hours after the interview, to find out why the hiring supervisor did not show up. She explained, “sometimes the day can get away from us”. I agreed to reschedule the interview for another day. On this second try, I was interviewed by the team’s clerical operations supervisor, who was 30 minutes late to the scheduled interview. The hiring supervisor from the previous day was supposed to be present as well, but again, she was completely absent. The interview was fairly easy. General questions were asked, such as, ‘where do you see yourself in the next five years?’, ‘what would your previous employers say about you?’, ‘why Scripps?’ etc. Exactly 2 weeks after the interview, I received an email stating that the position has been cancelled. I’m incredibly shocked at how the hiring process was conducted by Scripps Health. Word of advice: Please respect your potential candidate’s time and efforts to be a part of your team. I have never experienced this amount of disrespect and unprofessionalism within an interview process. I will not be applying to this company in the future.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself in five years?

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application and after 2 months received email from recruiter with invitation to upload pre-recorded video interview (4 questions). No updates until about 2 weeks later, at which point began receiving weekly email messages with status updates. Each update was copied verbatim as a general message describing I was still "in consideration". Contacted recruiter for clarification regarding timeline. Recruiter graciously replied they would follow up. Never heard back. Sent follow-up emails to no avail. In the meantime, Scripps portal showed two new applications to the same job posting submitted on my behalf. I was never informed why or asked to verify the submissions for accuracy. Job description was rewritten and reposted. Email received with the title stating I was invited to interview, however the link provided only asked one question regarding licensure. Sent email to recruiter asking for clarification. Out of office reply provided contact information for two other recruiters. Emailed them to no avail. Ultimately received email from Scripps informing me I had not been selected. Attempted contact with recruiter. No answer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Scripps? How did you improve an process? Describe a time of conflict at work. Describe a time you went above and beyond to help a patient.

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Automatic digital pre-recorded interview given after submitting online application, but only 72 hours to do it. 3 minutes of recording allowed per question but unlimited retakes given and the ability to stop in the middle and finish later. If you submit additional applications for multiple roles, Scripps will automatically use your original video responses for all proceeding applications. It varied for each role, but within a few days to a two weeks I was updated by email if my application was forwarded to the recruiter. If the recruiter likes you, they will then ask you to set up a live video interview with the hiring manager. Some had me facetime while others had me use their formal ModernHire platform. I was expecting technical questions on the second interview but mine were all behavioral and some basic yes/no answers on if I know how to do vitals and the extent of my experience. The recruiter then let me know if I got the job in no later than a few days. My fastest turn around on an offer was two hours after my interview with the hiring manager. My experience is limited to my 100-hr clinical externship but I used my other customer service and public health experiences to convey how patient-centered I am and eager to learn! The hiring managers both said they clearly saw that in my resume and responses so I highly recommend reminding them of your patient-centeredness in nearly every question answer (where appropriate). I finished my interviews by asking each of them if they had any doubts about my ability to succeed in the role; I really think this helps not only give opportunities to further explain why you're fit for the role if they have doubts, but also helps them reflect on their impression of you and say it out loud--its also shows confidence and a huge effort to showcase your eagnerness. Good luck!
Interview Questions:
Why Scripps?

Time you went above and beyond for a patient/customer?

Time you had a conflict with a coworker and how did you resolve it?

Time you increased efficiency in the workplace in a past role?

Describe a project or decision that you're most proud of from the past year.

I was asked about how I have been there for the patient and in why did I choose Scripps. Towards the end I was given two very hard questions and answered them as best as I could. I was interviewed by 2 people at the same time via facetime.
Interview Questions: What is one way you have gone above and beyond for a patient ?

title: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Rancho Bernardo, CA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews for different departments: one was an On-Demand video interview and the second was a video call with the manager. Very positive experience and fair process overall.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Scripps?

title: Materials Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: over the phone, via zoom.  2 people were on zoom.  Did hear one of the people make noises, as in okay, I'm not really sure if I believe you.  Other then that, thought it went well and thought I would get a call back.  Now they are looking to hire for the same position, seems as if they person they chose did not work out.
Interview Questions: reviewed qualifications, experience, and past issues.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Pre-screening questions with recorded video answers, then when passes pre-screening you may have interview with Supervisor or panel interview. Panel interview may be with colleagues and supervisors. Describing person experience and hypothetical questions
Interview Questions: What have you contributed to your department What was something you taught to another colleague

title: Lead Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy and direct questions based on practical experience. One phone interview, followed by an in-person interview.  Necessary Certification was a must.  All relevant questions were asked based on your resume.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to multi-task?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions:
1. Initial 15 phone screen with HR. More of a touch base about your background and if you fit the position
2. 60 min phone interview with hiring manager. The interview was through their dial in number. Interview wasn’t too difficult but they were specific to what they were looking for and the role that they would have in the organization.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen. Large panel interview (8-10) people. Questions based on previous work related to role. Questions on your process and how you accomplish goals and measure success. Specific examples requested - no generalizations.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time you worked with a difficult physician.

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted about completing a online interview that consisted of 4 questions that could be down on my own time (within 3 days), and re-recorded.  From there I was contacted within a week that I had moved on to the next interview, which was with the hiring manager and 2 supervisors on the floor. Super nice and welcoming!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Scripps?

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was relatively easy. Self-paced, video on-demand interview that must be completed within 72 hours of when the interview invitation was sent.  I then had a phone interview with the department manager a couple days later.  Was offered the job after my interview.
Interview Questions:
1.	Why would you like to join our connected and patient-focused culture?
2.	Tell us about a time you went the extra mile to meet the needs of a patient or customer?
3.	Tell us about an improvement you made in your current role.  What was the outcome?
4.	Please describe a disagreement you recently had with another person at work.  How did you handle the situation?

title: RN- Float Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Oceanside, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over the phone due to COVID restrictions, I know some interviews were done through video call, as well. Interview process was fairly simple, easy going and friendly. He allowed me to ask questions about the organization and about floating.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you had a disagreement with a coworker.
What made you want to be a float nurse?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an invite to complete an online prerecorded interview. The pre-recorded interview was also used for more than one job I applied for at Scripps. Then a week later I got an invite to complete a live interview online.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict you had at work.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Personable and comfortable. Pleasant and easy to arrange. I enjoyed it. There wasn’t an issue I met with two managers and ended up taking a position I didn’t even apply to.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: I had to 3 days to record myself for 5 questions on Hiring Manager. A day late,  I got an opportunity to schedule an appointment to a 2nd interview which is going to be through Hiring Manager as well.
Interview Questions: What interests you about Scripps?

title: Patient Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: The self paced interview consisted of a 4 videos of pre-recorded questions, I answered via video and I was able to rerecord as needed. I haven't heard back yet, but I will update this if I do. I put be low that "I didn't get the job" but there wasn't an option to put "waiting for a call back."
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: I have completed the self-paced interview process that included 4 questions. You are able to redo them before you actually submit them. Questions were not too challenging, mostly basic soft skills interview type questions. I am in the next phase and was invited for a live interview after I sent in the self-paced video. So that is why my answer for the offer says no for now because the application process is still going.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a conflict at work?

title: Food Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the application, I received an email to perform a self-pace interview. You have 3 days to complete the interview. The self-pace interview is simple. You answer about 4 questions.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work here?

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Scripps Health in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 2-3 weeks first you apply online, you get your application forwarded to manager of the department, and get called for an interview. I was excited for this interview. Until the hiring manager did  not even say hello! She did not seem like she did not want to hire me or any interest of speaking to me. She kept looking to her left from the beginning to the end. I knew I would not get hired from the second I said hello.  The individual did not look happy and treated the interview as non existant
Interview Questions: Tell me a time a patient was upset and how did you handle it?

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: I thought the hiring process was great, albeit a little slow. I applied and then heard back within a week or two when I was asked to schedule an asynchronous interview. I completed this and then was invited to a real interview with a supervisor. They also sent a skills test to complete for PCA/CNA competencies. The hiring manager was super nice during my virtual interview, (they use ModernHire) and multiple people reaching out were all kind and very accommodating along the way. For the interview, questions were asked about everything from the job itself to my skill set.
Interview Questions: Have you ever received disciplinary action on a job or license?

title: Kitchen Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two ladies who wrote down word for word everything I said in response to third questions.  The interview took place in the dining room of the Scripps Green hospital.
Interview Questions: Situational questions. What would you do here? Describe a time you dealt with this?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an invitation that same day to do a self paced taped interview. The self paced interview was very convenient and easy to do and took a lot of the pressure out of a real in person interview. You can redo your answers as many times as you want.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Scripps?

title: New Graduate RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took around a month. Applied online and received an interview invite. Standard behavioral questions, the process was overall very easy and everyone I interacted with was very kind and professional.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with interruptions at work?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was informed via email that I was selected to do  a virtual interview and was given a window in which I had to complete it. The software was easy to use, the questions were typical behavioral type, and you were given unlimited re-recordings to answer your questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about an improvement you made in your current role. What was the outcome?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 2 people and the whole interview was about 10 minutes long. They give you a time and date and you have to be there at that time in order to get an interview. They were organized and had people getting in and out quickly.
Interview Questions: what was your most frustrating clinical experience?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health (Carlsbad, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position and received an email asking to complete a four question self paced interview. I’m glad I was given time to really think about my answers and the ability to re-record my answers if I didn’t like them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Scripps Health?

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: 3 step process. Apply online, get an interview with a recruiter, then interview with manager of the unit. Interview with recruiter will determine the likelihood of getting the position. But vetting is harsh for the initial application. Overachingly the entire system is easy to manage but difficult to get past the I goal vetting process.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you went above and beyond for a patient?

title: Diet Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a positive experience all around, from start to finish. The recruiter who contacted me as well as the Dietician who interviewed me were both very nice. The person who interviewed me made me feel very comfortable throughout the interview. She was very thorough and informative of the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Scripps?

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: First you record yourself answering about five interview questions. Then if selected you will have a phone interview.  Some questions might be the same for both interviews but questions will increase in quantity as the interview process continues.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a series of questions from a panel of employees including the clinical manager, nurses, patient service representatives, and other medical assistants. I was also given a tour of the full clinic.
Interview Questions: What are 3 great qualities that coworkers would attribute to you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easily applied online and did a video interview with an automated person asking questions. It was self-paced so I enjoyed that aspect and I felt that I could thoroughly think about the questions and answer it to the best of my ability.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Scripps?

title: Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: applied online, got several emails then I got a call from the main supervisor to go in for an interview. Went the next day, got a job offer on spot. The guy from the parking structure was very nice and did not charge me for the day. Overall, very nice and positive atmosphere.
Interview Questions: about telemetry and an Test

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Took about a month to hear back after I applied to the position. I was sent an email with a scheduled time and wasn’t given another option so I had to be free at that time. However they did let us know when applying to block out two days to make sure we could attend the interview. When I arrived there were 4 people on the panel that interviewed me.
Interview Questions: What is one word your friends would use to describe you?

title: Spd Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were very pleasant and calm. The whole interview lasted about 25 minutes and interviewers were forthcoming with their opinions of how I did. I was told what to expect next and an approximate time frame for the next steps of the process.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in one word.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I went through three interviews. The first was a video interview, then interview with HR, and finally an in-person panel interview. I felt like I did great. If I am honest with myself, the position was not necessarily below me, but I would have been going backward. I only applied to try and get my foot into the door at Scripps, but I definitely would have stayed in the position for a few years. In all honesty, I think the VP already had made up her mind about who she wanted before I arrived. The interview was supposed to be a 3-panel interview. However, it ended up being just the VP and her Exec Asst. The interview panel, in addition to several comments made by the VP during the meeting, signaled to me that they did not take the interview seriously. I was told on Halloween via email (out of all days) that I was not selected. It was a bummer, but I suppose it's onwards and upwards. Your loss Scripps! *Pretty Woman voice*
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when your day did not go as planned?

title: Patient Access Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 3 people. Interview went well.  Each person asked about 3-4 questions. They made me feel comfortable which made the interview process a little less overwhelming. They  offered me the position within a weeks time.
Interview Questions: .Tell us about your healthcare experience ?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Call and a brief overview of the position followed by an invited to be interviewed in person. 
The in person interview consisted of a group of people taking turns to ask general questions and an overview of the job and daily tasks.
Interview Questions:
explain a difficult situation you have faced?
Why Scripps?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the website and one of the physicians in charge of hiring for this particular position reached out to me. After emailing back and forth, we set up time for the interview. The interview was very professional and formal.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your job/experience at "XYZ Company"?

title: Food Service Partner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview conducted by hiring managers representing multiple Scripps locations, and consisted of several scenario and experience questions related to the position. After the panel interview we were then interviewed one-on-one with an HR supervisor that wanted to get a better understanding of our plans and why we'd potentially be a good fit for the job.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy I had a panel and from the time I applied to the interview it was several weeks. The panel is usually at their CFLI location in Clairemont. I applied for the new graduate position.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got a call from HR, had a phone screen with manager, then a phone interview with manager and other professional. References were checked and then offer was given via telephone and email.
Interview Questions: How would you resolve a conflict with a coworker?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Encinitas, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly quick, beginning with a short introduction about yourself and followed by some "rapid-fire" questions relating to your work style. There were two interviewers and one spectator.
Interview Questions: How would you describe a good day for you?

title: Family Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant the physician was very professional answered all my questions. The interview was 1:1 and about 1 hour. Before the 1:1 interview there will first be a 30-minute telephone interview. This is basicallly describing the department.
Interview Questions: What do you want to work this departs and at Scripps?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple panels that day for each Scripps location. I was interviewing for  Scripps La Jolla. It was a panel interview with 3-4 hiring managers. Each asked a question. They were friendly. It lasted about 30 minutes
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone said don’t ask questions, just do it?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Long interview process, it took me over a month to start working once I found out I got the job. They should try and speed up the hiring process. The interview was me an a panel of 5 employees and the manager.
Interview Questions: How will you be an asset to the company?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The initial phone call to interview was not very productive. There was no feel run down of the position just a "do you want to interview and what time?" The interview was not very interactive, was very rushed and the interviewers quite frankly did not seem too interested in interview process.
Interview Questions: Not much as how your experience qualifies you for the position.

title: Pharmacy Technician Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a call from a recruiter about a month later to describe the position and ask a few screener questions (tell me about yourself, how do you handle stress, do you work well in a team environment, etc.) On the same call she then set up an in-person interview scheduled a week later with the Pharmacy Manager, and sent me an email a few minutes later to confirm. The interview was supposed to be a panel interview with several people in the pharmacy, but due to scheduling concerns the interview was conducted by the Pharmacy Manager and another Pharmacy Technician Specialist who had already had the position for quite some time. They asked questions very unique to the position (can you work with blood or bad smells, are you independent, what are you looking for in a job, are you a fast or slow worker, etc.), scenario questions to test your reasoning and logic (prioritizing certain patients over others), and questions to assure I was familiar with commonly prescribed drugs. They were very kind, but also very direct and determined to find the right person for the job. I received a call about a week later from the recruiter who offered me the position.
Interview Questions: Are you a fast or slow talker?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with hiring managers and charge nurses from several units. They prefer quick and concise answers. I think mine was about 15 minutes long. Mostly behavioral and situational questions. No clinical questions.
Interview Questions: Name three strengths

title: Ultrasound Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: STAR interview style that was a little intimidating at first because it was unexpected but overall was a positive experience. Turned off by the fact that the job details/schedule/benefits were very different than what was originally described in the job posting. I applied for a full time benefits position Monday - Friday, only to be told at the end of the interview it was a Per Diem, no benefits position.
Interview Questions: I was asked to describe a problem I had within my current workplace and how I resolved it.

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: short with 2 people. Asked simple questions regarding the position and had opportunity to ask them questions. Was offered the position a few days later. Was a very easy and fast process.
Interview Questions: What is something your former employer would say about you?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Greeted by nurse recruiter, panel interview with 3-4 nurse leaders in specific department. Mostly behavioral based questions with additional “rapid fire” questions (do you prefer this or that...). Heard from HR within a week with conditional job offer and directions to complete health screening, background check, drug screen, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had conflict with a coworker.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Terrible.  Here is how the recruiting process goes:
-Apply
-Apply
-Apply
-Apply
-Apply
Keep paying
-Recieve multiple "thanks but no thanks" emails
-Recieve a few "Please provide further information because your application is under manager review"
-Fill out all the requested information
-Recieve a phone call from HR
-Return HE's phone call
-No answer? Leave vm
-HR never returns your call
-You call again
-HR hangs up on you in mid sentence
-HR never returns your phone call after they hang up on you
-No response from all that information that they requested.

End of recruitment process.
Interview Questions: Please provide further information to which goes nowhere

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute interview with a panel of 3 managers from the program. Since we were informed that it was going to be short, I prepared short and concise answers for basic questions (so short,  I was there for only 25 minutes including questions I asked).
Interview Questions: Give 3 words that describe you?

title: Patient Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Chula Vista, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied 2 weeks ago and received a call from the hiring manager to come in for a face to face interview. It was a 30-min with the hiring manager and team lead. They asked standard situational and behavioral questions. Received a call same day with an offer.
Interview Questions: Do you like scores to measure your performance

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applications are available online, a talent questionnaire is required at the end of your application, HR recruiter will contact you and either recommend you to the department manager, or not. If recommended, you will interview with the department manager, they will decided to extend a former offer for your review, or not. If you get the offer, you must respond promptly by accepting or negotiating. Once accepted, you’ll have blood work, physical, and company orientation before starting at your hospital.
Interview Questions: The most frustrating questions were phrased “what would you PREFER” when discussing shifts, days of the week, and location..

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied multiple times and I finally got a call back for an interview. The following Thursday I attended the interview and took about 30 min. She basically wanted to get to know me a little more and asked about my past jobs followed by 8-12 questions.
Interview Questions: What is a good day for you?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: You meet with a panel of four to interview.  a serious of different questions are asked, so be on your toes to answer with a quick , and professional answer.
Interview Questions: Don't want to ruin it for the next candidate, " Be prepared " is all  i want to  give as a readiness suggestion.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: applied online. First status showed application received, then it changed to under review, then it changed to hiring manager review, and finally got an email invitation for interview.  THe interview day and time was set and you had to either accept or decline the invitation.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourseld

title: Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Wildomar, CA)
Interview Descriptions: First I filled out the online application, next I took an online personality test, then I did a phone interview, last was an on site in person interview with 2 managers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Director of Clinical Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Telephone screening initially with hiring manager followed by three on-site panel interviews in two separate days.  First on-site was one-hour with hiring manager's colleagues.  Second on-site interviews were comprised of lead physicians in the first hour and the leadership team in the second hour.
Interview Questions: How to approach group of long-time employees in cliques to change their behavior.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was simple and direct. I first received a screen call to verify what I was interested in, and then moved onto a in person interview, where I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where  you deescalated an issue. What steps did you take to ensure the satisfaction of the patient's request, within the scope of practice.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Marcos, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief phone interview with HR and was offered an in-person interview for the following week. Both interviewers were friendly and I thought the interview went really well. They most had standard questions like, how do you handle working with a coworker you don't get along with or with a difficult patient. After 2 weeks of not hearing back, I tried contacting HR multiple times for an update but never heard back. They just left me hanging. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: lots of situational questions: describe I time when..., describe how you would...

title: Kitchen Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews.  1 phone, 2 in person. The final interview they had me meet the team and go over technicals of what I'd be responsible for and how I would approach those situations/issues.
Interview Questions: Name one word that describes you.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview of four including the person I would be replacing. Introductions and explanation of job. There was a lot of light jokes. It was a non serious environment. I left feeling very confident.
Interview Questions: What makes you think you're the best fit for this job?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a lengthy online application with long personality quiz/survey,  then a phone interview, then an in-person interview.  I was told there would be 3 interviewers, but one was unavailable and the other two were about 30 minutes late. The Operations Manager was very friendly. I received a call back the same day as the in-person interview regarding extending an offer. They didn't require a references check.
Interview Questions: Do you like games that challenge you or make you think? Give examples.

title: Recruiting Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied on their website
Received and email with date and time of interview
Group interview with a panel 

Extremely easy panel interview. Very friendly staff.  They're located in Kearny Mesa not inside of a hospital.
Interview Questions: How do you provide customer service

title: Pharmacy Technician Specialist-patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Phone Interview, then invited for a panel interview (ended up just being with the 2 pharmacists I would have been working with).  Was pretty straightforward, there was one role play situation where I was the technician calling a patient regarding an approved prior authorization for a NF medication and was asked to calm the patient after revealing their copay was still pretty high!

**as far as any follow up; I tried to contact them on multiple occasions, but was given the runaround! I wish they would have told me outright that I was not going to be chosen to move forward in the process! **
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to work as a team

title: Cardiovascular Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the company’s website, and then submitted a resume, and references. Interview was with a panel and included a few brief get know you questions, a few technical background questions, and some referencing my resume.  Questions did not go into depth about my technical experience, but were more about how I heard about the job and why at this Hospital.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Tele Tech Days FT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Encinitas, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied on-line. Got a call from the Director. She asked me a few interview questions over the phone. She then set up an interview to come in and meet in person. I met with her, took a test and then sat with 2 tele techs for a while to get the feel of things. Very positive experience. Although, I do not agree on the testing part. I do not feel a test determines how good of an employee you are. I'd say 8 out of 10 questions on the test in my 10 years of being a seasoned Cardiac Monitor Technician have I ever been asked such questions that were the fort 10 or 12 questions on the test. Had the test been solely on rhythm strips it would have been a better out come. I truly believe you cannot base a persons ability to do a very good and outstanding job based on a test. In reality there are some people that just do not test well but, are the best workers ever!
Interview Questions: What would your co-workers say about you?

title: MA Interview
Application Type: The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied and got a call about 4 weeks later.  Interviewed with a supervisor and 2 other MA's. Got a call about a week later with offer.  Whole process was good.
Interview Questions: What makes a good day for you?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Short scripted interview without opportunity to interact with interviewers. Panel interview with introduction that interview would last 45 minutes, to answer completely but quickly to allow for all questions. Interview began 10 minutes late so interview panel appeared to be in great rush to get through interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Biomedical Equipment Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview definitely focused on work ability Independent working conditions, flexibility with working hours and possible stay late condition  and customer service along with the ability to perform job specifics.
Interview Questions: what drives you?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 and peer interview. Involve the whole team in the success of the potential employee; they become invested in success of the new hire. Excellent hiring process for both parties involved. Scripps is a great company to work for.
Interview Questions: A project/campaign most proud of

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were several panels going on at the same time. In one room, it was my panel interview with someone else's on the other side of the room. I'm not sure about the rest. My panel was with current RNs from different units and no managers or executives.
Interview Questions: Describe your perfect day.

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviewers with in-depth interview to see if it will be a good fit for all parties. Interview usually takes approximately one hour to complete. Get there early parking can be difficult
Interview Questions: What is your priority in your job

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Office was under construction, so there was no clear way to find someone for help. After calling the manager she came out and got me, she was clearly unprepared and all over the place. Trying to make the best of it, I stayed professional and we started the interview. Simple questions about my previous job, such as duties and situations. We discussed the position further and she said I would be expecting a call by the end of the week. Never received a phone call back even after calling to follow up. Weirdest interview experience.
Interview Questions: Previous job duties and situations

title: Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had to go through temp agency to get in door.  To get directly in the company I don't see anyone doing.  Everyone goes through a temp agency- and they only use one.  And then they hire from who makes it through based on performance over a few months. The rest seem to get fired and they start all over.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with unhappy callers?

title: Test Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was not what I have expected. It took longer than necessary. Some people were late and were also in a hurry to finish. I would not recommend based on my experience.
Interview Questions: What is your best experience

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Encinitas, CA)
Interview Descriptions: referred by an employee at Scripps I called the nursing supervisor to come in and  Apply in person had brief  phone interview then a panel interview waited on what they were waiting to pay me got the call and accepted position
Interview Questions: why would you like to work at scripps

title: Patient Account Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by managers 2 managers and 2 supervisors of 3 different departments at my first and only interview. Prior to the meeting portion of the interview they requested that I take a test to assess my understanding of billing in healthcare. Then they took turns asking questions about my life, my dreams, my experience, and my view of the health care industry and of the position I was applying for. They were all very approachable and kind, and it didn't feel like an interrogation in the least, even though there were 4 of them.
Interview Questions: What did I like most about working in Healthcare?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call and did a cold interview on the phone....then I got the call that the doctors wanted to interview me in person at the hospital.  It seemed like a pretty seamless process.
Interview Questions: What about your experience would make you a good fit for this position?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call a few days after applying and had and scheduled an interview the following week. There were three interviewers asking questions and it lasted 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Patient Service Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received email for phone screen 2 days later. Was asked for 1:1 on a Friday with hiring manager. Interview was fairly easy & I was offered the position the following Monday
Interview Questions: How do you handle angry patients or employees

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews in the process over two week period. I was impressed with the commitment the manager and team members showed in regards to finding the right person for this position.
Interview Questions: Q: What is your belief regarding friendships with colleagues outside of the workplace?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online 09/15/2016. About 1 week later I received a call from the manager offering me an interview a few days later. I was interviewed by the site manager and director.  Quick 10-15 min interview.  I received a call few days later asking me if I was interested in a 2nd interview with some of the staff (dr's and MA's). Of course, I agreed.

A few days after that I received a call from HR (John) offering me the position with start dat 10/31/2016.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview very short and structured. I felt like interviewers were rushed having to see many people throughout the day. There were two interviewers. Each  specialty had their own panel consisting of two people.  There were five or six stations total.
Interview Questions: Name three qualities that you look in your manager?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very well structured and very organized. The hiring manager was very nice and we'll knowledgable. Very pleasant experience and I felt really good and feel that this company is very good.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a situation where you were right and everyone is wrong.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: First you get a screening phone interview.  Then an in-person interview.  Mine were one-on-one.  Occasionally offices like to do another interview with more staff.  Like everywhere it is slow, and once they decided to hire me it took over a month to start.  Before the 1:1 interview they give you a super simple test mostly about medication dosages (e.g. if a medication comes as 10mg/mL, and the Dr orders 5mg how many mL do you draw up?).  Then you talk for about 30 minutes with a manager.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your time?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone conversations; email and offer sent by HR - very unpersonable.I was sent an offer sheet and all I had to do was sign. The very next day, the manager apologized and retracted the position  The kicker was giving the position to a newly "trained" RN
Interview Questions: How would I diffuse a bad interaction

title: Food Service Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions:
1. Submitted application
2. phone interview
3. interview with supervisors
4. got hired
5. background check in process, waiting for call o start training

The supervisors were really nice and I felt in a comfortable environment in the interview.  They asked some scenario questions.  They really care about teamwork, flexibility, and ability to work in a fast paced environment in an efficient way.
Interview Questions: What makes a good healthcare provider?

title: EVS - Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: the whole process was short and sweet, not too many questions and my interviewer was very helpful, kine, and honest. i think that anyone who goes thru this interview process will be very happy
Interview Questions: Do You Know What Your Doing

title: Lift Team Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Santa Ana, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was great to do that interview please help the way you go there never the problem glass door reverence tge honor of my people will never fualter, you have no hope for those that defy us the chosen people, you demons shall fail with out a doubt, perish now!!
Interview Questions: How do you do in a destruction environment

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process for me was very fast. After applying the recruiter contacted me the same day that I applied letting me know I had been chosen to move forward in the process and to submit for background. I interviewed  once a week later. Two days later I was contacted back and offered the position.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to make a spreadsheet using Excel?

title: Receiver/Supplies Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview- which included questions about the company, your knowledge of the position, followed by a interview at the hospital, which asked questions based more around yourself and your work ethic and experience
Interview Questions: What do you take pride in?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Encinitas, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: basic questions that anyone could answer off the top of their heads, very easy and quick. You don't have any need to prepare and will do well! They really need volunteers.
Interview Questions: why do you want to volunteer?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was an individual  in person interview with the departmet  manager and supervisor. They asked questions specific to OT and questions from Scripps. Both interviewers were accommodating and kind
Interview Questions: What are good traits to have as an OT?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I had interviewed with two different departments. I applied online and was called within a week. Only one interview for each position. There wasn't a need for a second interview. Both were panel interviews. I was offered the position and then started my background check.  It took 2 full weeks for the background check through Hire Right. Once when that cleared I started in two weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell us of a time that you set a goal and succeeded in achieving. Explain what it was and what you did to achieve it.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager called and asked a couple questions about if I was interested in working for them. Asked about my experience and why I wanted to work for the company over the phone. I was then prompted for a small background check through email. After that a group panel interview was set up, I interviewed with 7 people total, mostly the nursing staff and Medical assistants i would be working with. They each asked about 2-3 questions. Overall very nerve racking experience but they were very nice and made it easier. I was offered the position about 2 days later as the manager said she had 1 more candidate to interview. The interview questions were more character based and a couple scenario questions with the staff more than with patients.
Interview Questions: How would you feel and how would you handle this if you told (nurses name) that you would help her complete a task and ended up not being able to?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: I was given time to answer the quiz questions, then I got called in to the room for my interview, my interview was rushed and distracted after the first 10mins, this was a float pool position,
Interview Questions: Do other nurses come to you for help?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: phone screening and interview, after 2 weeks face to face interview. then a phone call offer and explanation of benefits. the process took 2 months including background check and drug tests
Interview Questions: how can you handle stress

title: Training Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel of department members asking old school, scenario-based questions to probe your personality. No questions on skill level or experience for position. Received notice that I advanced to the next level. I never heard from them again. I saw on linked in they hired someone but they left me hanging. Very unprofessional and cliquish. Falsified job description since advertised as training specialist but wanted training admin also.
Interview Questions: What would your coworkers say about you? Really?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions:
My interview was conducted with an panel interview of the top 5 people in all of scripps pharmacy department and was asked several questions about my past experience..
Was very nerve racking and the one of the interviews that pretty much was going to decide to hire me told me either:  "you'll be receiving a job offer or a guaranteed second interview". 
I never heard back whatsoever and my online status went to: "no longer review" 
That was a suprise with no explanation whatsoever.
Very unprofessional, at least be courteous enough to let a prospective employee know what's going to happen instead of stringing along and then lying to their face in the interview.
For so called medical professionals, you sure have a funny way showing your professionalism and staying true to your words.
Interview Questions: what were your duties at your past wmployers?

title: Lab Assistant Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Group panel interview. Questions were a little difficult so had to really think about them before I gave a good answer. Questions consisted of scenario questions and skill questions. What would you do if so-so happened or when doing so-so what are the next steps after it.
Interview Questions: Gave scenario questions. What would you do?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Encinitas, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied and was called for an interview quickly and scheduled interview for that week. Interview with a week. Interview went very well, hiring manager was nice and laid back, basically told me I got the job on the spot and that my official offer would come in a few days, and it did. When the hiring department called me they told me the offer rate, which is $6 lower per hour than what I am making for the same position at another local hospital and that there was no negotiation, as it goes by experience on a sliding scale. Surprised that they weren't able willing to negotiate at all especially since I am employed by their competing hospital system. Would have loved to work there.
Interview Questions: Given a situation (call light going off, patient trying to get out of bed, and nurse calling your phone) in what order would you address the tasks and why?

title: Patient Service Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: brief telephone interview and was invited in for a panel interview (1 manager and 2 employees who have been working at Scripps for over 5 years), was then told I would get a call back within a week or so for the status, 3 weeks passed, did not hear back so I decided to call and follow up, was then told they are still interviewing and they would let me know. A few days later I log in to my job profile where I applied online and the status changed to "No longer under review".
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Access Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: long, lots of questions. a lot of people were involved. they want you to have insurance background. the people that interviewed me were fun and made it interesting. were asking upfront and wanted honest answers. they know what they are looking for but were nice about making sure it was a good fit for everyone.
Interview Questions: what would your coworkers say about you

title: Rad Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: They have streamlined the process and cut down the response time considerably. It used to take months - now it seems they have changed the process so that the site hiring managers have more input and get to see qualified candidates sooner.
Interview Questions: Prior experience

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview, took 3 weeks to get a call, was told I would get a call for a in person interview and the hiring manager never called back. I took the initiative and called, was then told again I would get a call back, 2 weeks pass and the status online with the job changed to "no longer under review".
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with manager,  supervisor and social worker supervisor.  Answered typical questions.   Interview includedate information on role.     Call back with offer was quick .  Background and physical scheduled an completed quickly
Interview Questions: Specificso on handling tough patients

title: Professional Develop Spec CFLI Instructional Design Full Time Day Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process here was the most grueling, dry, and impersonal experience I've ever had in my 30 years of job hunting. I had a phone interview followed by two face-to face interviews with different groups of people. I would not have accepted a job there if they offered me a million dollar salary as I would never want to work with these people.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I attended a seminar with bunch of people at the main hospital. There were student interns among other volunteers. It was a great experience to so many volunteers at the seminar.
Interview Questions: They asked you to introduce yourself in a group setting among other volunteers

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview process.. asked "What are my long term goals", "Tell me about yourself".. and so forth. Had the interview with the current manager as well as the supervisors. I kind of felt intimidated due to the fact that I wasn't prepared to have multiple people give me the interview. Other than that, it was like I mentioned, a basic interview.
Interview Questions: Was there any moments where you had to deal with an irate customer and how did you handle the situation?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: You fill out a standard personality test while submitting resume.  Then Phone Screen then face to face with Hiring manager.  Then negotiation with HR for Salary typical of anyplace else.  Drug test comes a week before you start after you are already hired.
Interview Questions: About past experience

title: Pharmacy Technician - Part Time Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Went during Interview event. Applied online and waited until it was my turn. Bring your certification and license. They can get it later but it looks better if you have it. Hand them your resume right when you see the interviewer. They will ask questions about yourself. I didn't have any experience but she liked my personality and that I was a people person. Then they told me only the graveyard shifts were available. I guess I couldn't hold my expression so they basically told me I wasn't the right fit and they were right. Late hours just were not do-able for me. They were really nice. Didn't get an offer but my confidence entering the working force wasn't effected.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yours (asked 3 times)

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: After submitting an application to them online, within 2 weeks I was contacted for an interview. I met with the volunteer program director and she interviewed me. It wasn't too intimidating and they were very informative.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to pursue a career in the healthcare field?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The application process is long, but system will save your info for additional submissions for different positions. When rejected for a position, the system notifies you, so if you DON'T hear, you are still in consideration.
Interview Questions:
What is your biggest weakness and how have you worked to overcome this? 
What was the best thing a manager has done to help you in your role?
Tell me about a time things didn't go as planned, and how your responded.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: This was an internal position.  I went through an interview with the hiring manager and a couple different panel interviews.  One with other IS staff and one with customers.
Interview Questions: No really challenging questions, I thought of them as pretty standard.

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy overall - multiple group interviews, phone interviews but nothing spectacular. This isn't Google
Interview Questions: Some technical questions that anybody with a CS degree should be comfortable to answer.

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got contacted by e-mail in about a month by the prospective supervisor to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview lasted for about 15 minutes, he didn't ask much questions, just told that I seemed to be a good fit for this position and asked some questions about my availability and visa situations. The same day got a e-mail from him inviting for the on-site interview. I was asked to prepare a talk about my previous research. The on-site interview lasted for about 2-3 hours, including the talk + questions/discussions, then individual communication with different people in a group, and a lunch.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Psr Hiring Pool Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Del Mar, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for over two years even though i met all of the qualifications i wasn't selected. Finally, i called human resources and spoke to someone asking what i have done wrong. They gave me recommendations and next thing i knew, i got an interview. they emailed  me for an interview for the hiring pool. i followed up and recurved an  appointment. The Interviewer was professional and friendly. She showed pride in Scripps and her job. She asked about questions and answered them appropriately and professionally.
Interview Questions: What would you do if your done with your work and it's time to go home but your coworker is not done?

title: Medical Receptionist/Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really easy. Easy questions were asked, and the staff was really polite and personable.
Interview Questions: "Where do you find yourself in 5 years?"

title: Food Service Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: They first do a phone screening with the supervisor calling you.  The panel interview is intimidating!  It's a panel of 5 people.  They are all supervisors and leads and the manager of the department.
Interview Questions: What is something that you are proud of?

title: Clinical Laboratory Techniction Assistant, Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a friend who recommended me and lucky for me that's how they more or less prefer to acquire out side candidates. My interview was with my supervisor and 2 other department leads. Very straight forward.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: They have a hiring fair at Scripps Mercy where you get the chance to interview for two hospitals.  You go in the morning dressed and ready with copies of your resume and they choose what unit you will be interviewing with. You then interview with the little manager of that particular unit.  A bad manager will just read off the piece of paper and not be spontaneous in asking questions which is the manager I got.  Very bad!  The second manager was awesome, from Mercy Hospital, very experienced and comfortable interviewing and asking questions of first person accounts of what I've done and how I handled situations. Totally aced it! Wish to God I had gone with Mercy instead of La Jolla Green!
Interview Questions: I got a total BS question. what do you think is the biggest issue facing nursing today?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health
Interview Descriptions: Very basic, they attempt to tell you how awesome their company is and how they are top ranked.   They will feed you good the first day to attempt to impress you.  Anyone that knows hospitals knows they are no where near the top of the competition .
Interview Questions: Very simple and basic.

title: Rad Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was prepared to answer the standard questions, like "tell me about yourself", "Why did you choose this profession?" But he didn't ask very many questions, and they were mostly open-ended behavioral/situational. "Tell me about a recent success. Why were you successful?" "What would be your ideal job/work environment?" "Tell me about a time, professionally, when you had to be flexible to complete a task/goal..."
Interview Questions: Would others (such as your faculty and classmates from school) consider you a leader?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: One on one meeting with the Nursing Supervisor in her office that lasted about 30 minutes. She then took me on a tour of the facility and introduced me to the different department employees that she was in charge of.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process was efficient and each person on panel asked multiple questions. In my opinion you answered to your experience. I did not think there were any wrong answers. You were graded by panel on different situations they could occur and how would you handle it.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you.

title: Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: If went fairly fast because I was working for UCSD so nurse manager was please that I knew the staffer that worked there as well I had drug screen orientation to floor and unit and various ceu classes before starting
Interview Questions: temp what would you report

title: Over Night CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Just have all your ducks in a row all your papers,school degrees medals honors certifications BLS card everything, even before your interview..... the manager took a look at my stack of papers and hired me immediately...... no one else cared about my papers
Interview Questions: Got experience? Always say of course, you have no idea...what I've been through... then briefly describe your job Try to be a happy person no matter the outcome.

title: Critical Care RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: The talent manager coordinated interview and hiring process with the department manager performing the formal 1:1 interview. Unfortunately, the left doesn't always know what the right is doing and it evokes a level of uncertainty from the future employee. At least, it did for me.
Interview Questions: What steps are you taking to advance your personal clinical practice?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Two panel interviews with team. The first interview was standard questions. The second focused  with more job specific situations and how I would handle those situations.
Interview Questions: Standard questions with a focus on how I dealt with change.

title: Manager Interview
