Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: After online application process, phone interview with director. 1:1 meeting with same director and then a large panel interview of about 6-8 other managers and directors. Process took about 3-4 weeks.
Interview Questions: All behavioral and situational management questions.

title: Operations Systems & Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed as an internal transfer.  The process began with an informal telephone interview with the (outgoing) manager, then progressed to an in-person interview with the manager, project manager, and a senior team member.  The in-person interview relied on pre-selected interview questions divided into several categories related to various topics, such as "interpersonal skills" (as one example).
Interview Questions: How has your education prepared you for this sort of position?

title: Lift Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Encinitas, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Casual talk with the previous manager. Not sure how it is with the new management as I didn't have to interview with them. I'm guessing it is 2-3 of them and maybe one lift tech interviewing you.
Interview Questions: Don't remember. The new management will probably ask you for related experience or customer service positions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview. Director of the department and 3 or 4 of the people who you will be working with. They take turns reading off of a printed sheet of questions and write down everything you say. This was kind of awkward as there was a lot of silence as they were writing.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you could not agree with a co-worker.

title: CT Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Short only asked a few questions about my work experience and how i found out about this position. They were focused on professionalism and be strict about following protocol during medical procedures. They described many situational question that I would face upon being hired. From dealing with difficult doctors and telling patients to comply with certain procedures. They temperature check you by exposing some of the difficult scenario you will face in this role
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a patient who did not wish to comply with our procedures

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward with strength and weakness, why u want to apply for position, what do you bring to Scripps, describe your last job, what project did you do to foster teamwork, behavior situation
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fairly easy.  You should know how to answer strength and weakness questions.  You should be able to answer situational questions.  They want to know how you work in a team environment.  The hiring manager and staff members who interview are very friendly and helpful to make the environment relaxing.  Just be yourself and things should work out well.
Interview Questions: What are some of your weaknesses

title: EMT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Scripps Health (Encinitas, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Entered into a room with many of the other interviewees, started in a line and sat down with the manager of the specific department we were interviewing for, and did a 10 minute interview each with the department manager. Basic questions were asked, mainly pertaining to what we have done and where we plan on going in the future.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and very thorough. Some technical questions but mostly it is about you. They a telent mine survey during the application and most of the questions are based on the answers on that survey.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations, like patients complaining?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: it was a panal interview where there were 4 employers interviewing you and you answered various questions.  They asked very difficult questions but I prepared for the interview before I met with them
Interview Questions: why should we hire you

title: Claims Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: When meeting with Jenny, I was pleasantly surprised at how friendly she was. Her office was warm and inviting filled with pictures of her handsome son. She shook my hand immediately and made note of my interview notebook. When she began the interview process, her tone immediately calmed my nervous energy. The interview felt like I was talking with an old friend that I was catching up with. Although this was a temporary job, she treated the interview as though I was going to be a permanent employee and an integral asset to her team.
Interview Questions: Honestly, I do not remember specific questions, only that most of the questions were standard.

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was not difficult at all. Since I already work in the system, I know the job requirements very well and was able to answer all the questions with no problem.
Interview Questions: What is your long term goal?

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: You must apply online, and complete a Talent questionnaire.  Scripps post jobs daily, and receives thousands of application for each job.  It's important to keep your eye on the job posting (check the website every afternoon around 4 PM), and submit your resume promptly.  You want to be one of the first applicants for the posting, or your resume will be lost in the sea of other applicants.
Interview Questions: What is the key to providing extraordinary patient or customer service?

title: Supervisor, Information Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was a closed loop.  No way someone from the outside had a real opportunity.  I was not really qualified, I just knew someone.  My feeling is that the end result was successful but when I look back and consider it the process was probably not thorough enough.
Interview Questions: None, the interview was cake.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the Scripps Health Care website. I was called for a phone interview 2 weeks after my application was submitted. I briefly spoke with the lead Medical Assistant for Pediatrics. She offered me a time to come in to meet the hiring manager for an interview. At that time, I did not know it was going to be a panel interview. I met with the hiring manager and panel of medical assistants working in the pediatric group. They each had a set of questions they asked me, and I answered each question to the best of my ability.  I was called back 1 week after the  interview and was offered the position. Two days later the talent manager called and sent me via email my hiring packet with instructions for my pre-employemnt paper work including date for physical and training. I also received a offer of acceptance which I faxed straight away.
Interview Questions: Do you think it's fair to treat every patient the same?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Met with Managers and then with Doctors
Interview Questions: Why do you deserve this job

title: PSR III Surgery Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy process once application is approved by HR and then sent to the hiring manager. I waited over 1 month until I heard from someone about an actual interview, then waited another 2 weeks until they presented me with an offer. If you are seeking employment immediately, please keep this in mind.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Just interviewed with one person on phone and another in person. Was pretty casual.
Interview Questions: What fruit describes you the best?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview was a surprise to me.  Walking in the room to see all those people ready to question me was very intimidating.  I would hope I had known in advance.  They seem to be very organized through the interview process however; they fail to send a thank you but no thank you note.
Interview Questions: How would you handle if an employee complains that the privous shift employee is not leaving everything in order (organized, cleaned, task completed) for the next shift.

title: Human Resources Within Scripps Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions: I don't have much details to give except it was a fairly lengthy process.  But that was years ago; since then, there have been improvements.  There was an initial screening over the phone and later I was invited to come in for my panel interview.  The questions were fairly general from you would get asked from other companies.  Overall, it was not too painful of a process.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Scripps Health (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions:
First interview with Rehab supervisor and one staff therapist, second with director of rehab.
Very nice, encouraging, not intimidating.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Scripps Health in May 2008
Interview Descriptions:
Process is regulated by HR recruiter who is sometime difficult to make contact with.  While it was easy to leave messages, it was much harder to get return call.  Early discussions with HR prior to job offer were challenging to get much substantive information.  Actual interview process on the other hand was much more efficient and informative.

Company devotes substantive time and effort into arranging continuing and escalating  effort to new employee orientation, mentoring and feedback.
Interview Questions: What and how are you prepared to do to ensure patient safety and confidentiality
